page.title: 20FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS ?
page.content: 3 development schemes were under discussion in 1984-85. EDEN ESTUARY. A plan to reclaim 200 acres of mudflats in order to build a National Golf School,practice ground and sports complex was proposed by a group of businessmen. Strong protests have been made that it would endanger wildlife in the Estuary. ( Page 04). STEP-ROCK. This,once popular,open-air swimming pool is now derelict. The District Council has been exploring ways of redeveloping the site. A fish farm or a sea-life centre have been suggested. Discussions are continuing. WORLD OF GOLF MUSEUM.The District Council launched plans in 1984 to build a museum on the Bruce Embankment to house the Spalding collection of golf memorabilia. It is hoped that this can be completed by 1987 at a cost of about Â£2.5 million.
